paper_title.en: Stereospecific interaction of one-handed helical polycations with chiral anions

description.en: Optically active polyamide helices were obtained by the reaction of axially dissymmetric (R)- or (S)-6,6'-dibromo-2,2-diethoxy-1,1'binaphthyl, 3,6-diaminoacridine (proflavine), and carbon monoxide using a palladium catalyst. The acridine units in the chiral backbone were protonated with chiral 10-camphorsulfonic acid. Circular dichroism measurements revealed that (R)-(-)-camphorsulfonate anion ((R)-(-)-CSA(-)) is more easily incorporated into the protonated right-handed polyamide helix than (S)-(+)-camphorsulfonate anion ((S)-(+)-CSA(-)) and that the left-handed cationic helix preferentially interacts with (R)-(-)-CSA(-) to (S)-(+)-CSA-. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Helix inversion of polyaniline by introducing o-toluidine units

description.en: An optically active copolyaniline, poly(aniline-co-o-toluidine), which forms a different helix structure from that of the corresponding homopolymers was obtained by chemically oxidative polymerization with (1S)-(+)-10-camphorsulfonic acid as the chiral inductor in organic media. Formation of the genuine copolymer rather than a mixture of the corresponding homopolymers was confirmed by cyclic voltammogram, UV/vis, and circular dichroism spectra. The circular dichroism spectra of polyaniline and poly(aniline-co-o-toluidine) at suitable copolymer composition when dissolved in the same organic solvents revealed that their helical windings induced by the same chiral acid are reversed to each other. It is very interesting that the helical conformation of polyaniline can be inverted by inserting o-toluidine units into the polymer main chain. Since the chirality of poly(aniline-co-o-toluidine) depends on the o-toluidine content, this stereo-controlled polymerization of aniline derivatives affords a method to tailor-make electrically conductive materials with specific electrochemical and chiroptical properties. As a proof of concept, extension of this approach to other optically active polymers will be also expected.

description.en: An optically active copolyaniline, poly(aniline-co-o-toluidine), which forms a different helix structure from that of the corresponding homopolymers was obtained by chemically oxidative polymerization with (1S)-(+)-10-camphorsulfonic acid as the chiral inductor in organic media. paper_title.en: Stereospecific interaction of one-handed helical polycations with chiral anions

description.en: Optically active polyamide helices were obtained by the reaction of axially dissymmetric (R)- or (S)-6,6′-dibromo-2,2′-diethoxy-1,1′-binaphthyl, 3,6-diaminoacridine (proflavine), and carbon monoxide using a palladium catalyst. The acridine units in the chiral backbone were protonated with chiral 10-camphorsulfonic acid. Circular dichroism measurements revealed that (R)-(-)-camphorsulfonate anion ((R)-(-)-CSA-) is more easily incorporated into the protonated right-handed polyamide helix than (S)-(+) -camphorsulfonate anion ((S)-(+)-CSA-) and that the left-handed cationic helix preferentially interacts with (R)-(-)-CSA- to (S)-(+)-CSA-. © 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. paper_title.en: Synthesis and properties of helical polyamides containing atropisomeric binaphthyl units and crown ether rings in the main chain
Synthesis and Properties of Helical Polyamides Containing Atropisomeric Binphtyl Units and Crown Ether Rings in the Main Chain.
Synthesis of polysiloxane-grafted fluoropolymers and their hydrophobic properties

description.en: A polydimethylsiloxane with an epoxide end group was grafted onto a fluoropolymer that had hydroxyl side chains by using protonic or Lewis acids as catalysts. Strong acids such as trifluoromethanesulfonic acid were found to be effective for the grafting of the polydimethylsiloxane of relatively large molecular weight (M-n 4440). A coating prepared from the graft polymer was so hydrophobic that a water droplet of 10 mu L slid down on its inclined plane surface (30 degrees with respect to the horizontal). ESCA analysis revealed that the siloxane branches are preferentially present on the surface. (C) 2000 John Wiley & Sons, Inc.

paper_title.ja: ポリシロキサンをグラフトしたフッ素化ポリマーの合成とその疎水物性
paper_title.en: Synthesis of Polysiloxane-Grafted Fluoropolymers and Their Hydrophobic Properties

description.ja: 反応性ポリジメチルシロキサンをフッ素化ポリマーにグラフ卜し，得られたハイブリットポリマーから作製した塗膜表面の疎水性を検討した。塗膜材料の疎水性は通常水の接触角により評価されるが，それは水の接触角が大きいと，水滴が塗膜表面から転落脱離し易いためである。本研究では塗膜表面における水滴の滑落性に着目して検討した結果，フッ素ポリマーにグラフ卜したポリジメチルシロキサンの分子鎖長が長いとグラフトポリマーの塗膜表面の自由エネルギーは減少し，水滴の滑落性が増した。水滴の滑落性の指標となる滑落角は塗膜表面の自由エネルギーの極性項と良い相関性を示した。
description.en: Hydrophobic hybrid polymers were synthesized by grafting end-reactive polydimethylsiloxanes onto fiuoropolymers that have hydroxyl side chains.Sliding of water droplets on the coatings prepared from the graft polymers was examined, in addition to measurements of contact angles, to evaluate hydrophobic properties of the polymeric materials. The sliding angle for water, which is defined as the angle at which a water droplet slides on a coating that is slowly tilted from the horizontal to the vertical position and gives an indication for interaction of water molecules with the materials, was discussed in relation to surface free energy of the coating. The relatively small sliding angles showed that the graft polymers are useful for practical uses as hydrophobicmaterials.

publication_name.en: Journal of The Adhesion Society of Japan

Synthesis of polydimethylsiloxane-grafted fluoropolymers and properties for hydrophobic materials

description.en: Isocyanate-terminated polydimethylsiloxane was synthesized and grafted onto a fluoropolymer having hydroxyl side chains. The hydrophobicity of the resulting hybrid polymer was determined by sliding a water droplet on the surface of a coating prepared from the graft polymer.
